name: Rolex Daytona 16523 Zenith
description: Pre-owned Rolex Daytona Ref 16523 (1990) boasts a handsome steel and gold finish, allowing collectors to invest in a gold Daytona watch without the price of an all-gold Rolex. However, it's what's inside this Rolex that really piques the interest of collectors in the know. Reference 16523 is powered by the Zenith "El Primero" cal. 4030 movement. When the Daytona hit the market in the 1960s, it was powered by a hand-wound movement. It was eventually replaced by the first self-winding Daytona movement via the "El Primero." This movement was outsourced to Zenith and then modified in-house to remove the date mechanism. As the first automatic Daytona, the Rolex Zenith ref. 16523 has since become a cult favorite among loyal collectors.
case: Stainless steel (40mm) w/ 18k yellow gold engraved tachymeter bezel and scratch resistant sapphire crystal

name: Rolex Daytona 16523 Black Dial
description: Pre-owned Rolex Daytona ref 16523 (1995) Before the invention of the in-house calibre 4130 Perpetual movement, the Rolex Chronograph was powered by the cal. 4030. This movement is often referred to by collectors as the Zenith El Primero and is widely sought-after among used Rolex enthusiasts in-the-know. The movement was famously produced in Zenith's factory and then modified by Rolex to beat at a rate of 28,800 bph and to remove the date aperture. The pre-owned Rolex 16710 is a cult favorite because it features the older-style case and bracelet, aluminum bezel, and Superluminova. It's classy, nostalgic, and timeless.

Ref. 16710 hails from the second generation of that series, which brought with it a refined case and movement for optimal comfort on the wrist. It was an immensely successful edition of the famed pilot's watch and was produced for many years in various iterations. Ref. 16710 for sale here is a coveted "Coke Rolex" featuring a striking black and red bezel, Tritium dial, and Oyster bracelet.

name: Vintage Rolex Sea-Dweller 1665 Double Red Sea-Dweller
description: Pre-owned Rolex Sea-Dweller ref 1665 (1978) in general are some of the rarest vintage Rolex sports models out there. Rolex introduced the celebrated model in 1967 and they still make it today. The Sea-Dweller was developed for use by professional deep-sea saturation divers, particularly with its inclusion of a "Helium Escape Valve" or "HEV" on the 9 o'clock side of the case to help the watch survive decompression from dry, pressurized environments. The earliest Sea-Dweller examples had red printing and are called "Single Red" because of the one line of red text about the 6 o'clock marker, while the "Double Red" (featured here) features the words "Sea-Dweller" and "Submariner 2000" in red text above the 6 o'clock marker. Rolex made the double red version until around 1978 and at that point they switched to all white text. Rolex continued to use all white text on the Sea-Dweller until 2017 when they re-introduced the 43mm 50th anniversary version with a single line of red text.
case: Stainless steel case; serial and reference numbers are clearly visible between the lugs. Inner case back is stamped 1665 "517XXXX".

description: Pre-owned Rolex Sky-Dweller reference 326934 (2018) utilizes a complex calibre 9001 perpetual movement and a ring command bezel system, allowing you to read home and local time, the date, and the month. Depending on which position the ring command bezel is in, the wearer can use it to adjust either the central hands, the 24-hour center ring, the date aperture or the day of the month, which is cleverly set above each coordinating hour marker. The movement also utilizes a Paramagnetic blue Parachrom hairspring and high performance Paraflex shock absorbers for a highly accurate reading. A 72-hour power reserve means that you can set your watch down on Friday evening and it will still read true when you walk into work on Monday morning. The beloved spelunker's tool watch includes everything the wearer needs to keep perfect time while in the dark, including a Maxi dial topped with brilliant Chromalight hour markers and Mercedes hands and a fixed 24-hour bezel that can be used to either track day and night hours or read a second time zone. name: Rolex Explorer 114270 Black Dial
description: Pre-owned Rolex Explorer ref 114270 (2003 - 2005) Why do collectors love the Explorer 36? It boasts a relatively modest design, considering it was produced by the world's most iconic luxury brand. In place of rotating bezels and precious metals, the Explorer 114270 opts for a rugged, no frills design featuring a smooth bezel, time-only dial, and stainless steel finish. The Explorer was inspired by the adventurous spirit of mountaineers Tenzing Norgay and Sir Edmund Hillary, who were the first men to reach the summit of Mount Everest. It utilizes Rolex's most reliable features, including a waterproof case hermetically sealed up to 100 meters and a Perpetual movement with self-winding. Reference 114270 is a modern, ready-for-anything edition of the Explorer series that also features a chronometer-rated movement and long-lasting lume.

The watch has seen a few upgrades since then, including the indices and hands, which we can see here on this newer production Rolex. The stick hands have been replaced with a traditional Mercedes-style hour hand and a skeleton minute hand for optimal visibility. Furthermore, the blued indices on early iterations of the watch have been replaced with glitzier white gold. As with all things Rolex, this attention to detail can make all the difference when searching for the perfect model for your wrist. Aesthetics aside, ref. 116680 is a truly impressive Rolex masterpiece. The movement boasts a programmable countdown and convenient fly-back function and works with the Ring Command Bezel. Buy the stainless steel Rolex 116680 today in excellent secondhand condition.

The flat link Oyster bracelet and Oysterclasp creates a secure hold that you can count on no matter where you roam. description: Pre-owned Panerai Submersible BMG-TECH ref PAM00692 (2018) is Panerai innovation at its best. Instead of furnishing the watch with typical steel or titanium, Panerai has chosen its proprietary BMG-TECH material. "BMG" stands for "bulk metallic glass" and is developed to resemble traditional watchmaking materials but with a lighter feel on the wrist and better resistance to scratches, shocks, and magnetic fields. The innovative material is ideal for the robust Submersible, a purpose-driven watch. Ref. PAM00692 features the brand's signature cushion-shaped case and lever-activated crown guard, as well as a uni-directional 60-minute diver's bezel and significant water resistance. It pairs the cool tones of the BMG-TECH with a handsome blue dial and rubber strap.

name: Rolex Explorer 1016 Tropical Dial
description: Rolex introduced the 1016 Explorer in 1959 and it was in production until 1989 making it one of the longest running produced references from the brand. At the beginning of the run Rolex made the dials glossy and then switched to the matte style around 1966. The example we have here is circa 1966 and features a glossy dial, this would have been the last variation of the glossy dial before Rolex went to the matte version. This watch was born with a black dial and over the years it has turned to a beautiful brown and caramel color throughout. The left side of the dial is a bit darker than the right side and the whole dial has aged in a atheistically pleasing way. Collectors tend to gravitate towards tropical dials like this because no two will age the exact same making them unique.
case: Very Good stainless steel case.  Caseback is stamped: 1016 "IV.65". Serial and reference numbers are clearly visible.
dial: Excellent tropical dial that has turned an uneven brown throughout.

name: Vintage Rolex GMT-Master 1675 Stainless Steel Oyster
description: The GMT Master is Rolex’s signature pilot’s watch, complete with dual-time capabilities. It came to market in 1955, with ref. 1675 following shortly after in 1959. It’s one of the most sought-after vintage Rolex watches on the secondary market because it’s instantly recognizable with its 24-hour bezel and dedicated GMT hand. The Rolex 1675 was also notably the first GMT Master to use crown guards. Rolex initially used glossy dials in the 1675 until around 1966 and switched to matte dials.  This circa 1969 example is in overall beautiful condition with it's beautifully aged lume and gorgeous bezel. Collectors refer to this dial variation as a Mark I "Long E." When looking at  the "Rolex" text on the dial the "E" has a longer central bar (same length as the top and bottom ones) and that is where this nickname comes from. Rolex made many iterations of the GMT over the years and this watch has a couple additional interesting things to note. This watch also has the correct date-wheel for the time period with the closed 6's and 9s as well as hooked 7s.  This watch is just stunning in the metal. The fuchsia bezel presents as a dark fuchsia color and dark blue in person that matches so well with the sandy colored lume. This watch is coming directly from the family of the original owner and we are glad they took such good care of it over years.
case: Stainless steel case; the inside caseback is stamped: "1675" "IV.68". The numbers are clearly visible between both sets of lugs.
dial: Excellent matte black dial with matching lume on dial and hands.
bracelet: Stainless steel expanding C&I Oyster bracelet with 12 links. The clasp is stamped "1-69."

name: Vintage Rolex Submariner 16800
description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 16800 (1984) is referred to as a transitional model by collectors. Rolex went from acrylic to sapphire crystal, an updated movement with quick-set date, and at the beginning of the run the watches featured matte dials like the previous 1680. Later in the production Rolex changed the dials to glossy with white gold surrounds. These are known as transitional models due to the blend of older and new features Rolex decided to use together.

dial: Matte black dial and service replacement hands
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster 93150 bracelet with 12 links, 593 end links and divers extension. The clasp is stamped CP12 indicating it is from 2010+ and is a later replacement.

name: Rolex Submariner 5512 Vintage
description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 5512 (1979) is an important reference in Submariner history; It was the first Submariner to feature crown guards, a detail that all Subs would have going forward and still do today. Throughout the production of the 5512 Rolex made many different variations, from glossy dials to matte dials with many slight updates and changes. The 5512 may look nearly identical to the 5513 (that came out in 1962, three years later) but the main difference would be that the 5512 has the chronometer certified movement (COSC). Since the 5512 had a COSC movement, they were more expensive than the 5513 and were not as popular, we see less of them in general. The 5512s would typically have four lines of text at the bottom of the dial and the 5513 always has two; that is one good way of telling apart the references at a glance Its not always that simple, early examples of the 5512 also have two lines of text, but still have the COSC movement.  Overall the 5512 is a cult favorite and we see many collectors gravitate towards these especially after they have gone down the rabbit hole.

bracelet: Stainless steel 93150 Oyster bracelet with 12 links, 580 end links and divers extension. Back of clasp is stamped "RS4" indicating it is from 2010.

name: Vintage Rolex GMT-Master 16750 Pepsi
description: Rolex produced the GMT Master 16750 for about 7 years from 1981 to 1988. During that time, the watch became available with either a glossy or matte dial. The glossy variant had white gold-trimmed indices, while the matte edition did not. The latter matte variant, like this example is more desirable and gives the watch a distinctly vintage look. This reference is considered transitional because Rolex upgraded the movement, it now has a quick-set date, but kept the matte dial and acrylic crystal like the previous reference 1675. Rolex also used open 6s and 9s in the date, adding to the vintage charm.

name: Rolex SeaDweller 116600 Ceramic
description: Pre-owned Rolex Sea-Dweller ref 116600 (2011 - 2023) is the quintessential deep saturation dive watch. In addition to featuring a waterproof screw-down crown to hermetically seal the case, reference 116600 also utilizes the industry's innovative Helium Escape Valve. This feature releases the gases that collect within the case, thus keeping the crystal intact during decompression stops and protecting the movement. The collection boasts water resistance up to 4,000 feet. The discontinued Rolex 116600 also includes a very desirable steel finish and black bezel and dial. This feature set is considered relatively modern and is widely sought-after on the secondary market.

name: Rolex Sea-Dweller 116600 Ceramic
description: Pre-owned Rolex Sea-Dweller ref 116600 designed to withstand up to 4,000 feet, the Rolex Sea-Dweller was created alongside professional divers to introduce a functional and highly resistant watch that can withstand extreme diving depths.  One of the most important features of this sleek model is the engraved 60-minute rotatable bezel that allows divers to safely measure diving time and decompression stops.  A truly reliable companion for any deep sea diver.  The substantial 40mm case features 904L stainless steel and a helium escape valve.  The bezel's notched edge offers an easy under water grip, with or without gloves, and a black dial boasts ultra luminescent hour markers that are easy to read in even the darkest environments.  The stainless steel three-piece oyster bracelet is specially designed for the Sea-Dweller with divers in mind.  The Oysterlock clasp is expertly crafted so that it won't accidentally open and an innovative Glidelock allows the length to be adjusted without the use of tools so that the watch can be worn over wet suits.

name: Rolex Yacht-Master II Ref 116680 White Dial
description: Pre-owned Rolex Yacht-Master II ref 116680 (2019) is a lesson in expert Swiss watchmaking. In addition to boasting a stunning and sophisticated outward appearance, this model also boasts the most sophisticated movement and bezel in Rolex history. The Caliber 4161 is accurate up to -2/+2 seconds per day and features a 72-hour power reserve, programmable countdown, mechanical memory, and fly-back synchronization. Even more impressive is the Ring Command bezel, which operates in conjunction with the movement instead of independently from it. The wearer can access the programmable countdown by rotating the bezel into various positions. Not to mention, it's stunning in lustrous blue ceramic. The stainless steel model is among the most sought-after of the iconic Rolex regatta chronographs. Take advantage of the chance to add one to your collection in excellent secondhand condition.

description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 16803 (1988). Rolex introduced the iconic diver's watch at Basel Watch Fair 1954. The matching bezel features a blue aluminum insert with yellow gold 60-minute graduations. As a traditional Rolex diver's watch, the bezel is also unidirectional, and the case is waterproof up to 1,000 feet. Shop our selection of the Rolex Submariner Blue dial watches for sale.

name: Patek Philippe Perpetual Calendar 18k Yellow Gold
description: Pre-owned Patek Philippe Perpetual Calendar ref 5040J-016 (1998 - 2007) owes its irresistibly elegant aesthetic to the stunning yellow gold finish, retro tonneau-shaped case, and tri-register dial. It’s the perfect balance between functionality and luxury, and we would expect nothing less from Patek Philippe - the Master of Calibers. Ref. 5040J-016 is driven by the caliber 240 Q self-winding mechanical movement, complete with the day of the week, month, date, and moon phase. Tucked inside the register at 3 o'clock is a convenient leap-year counter, and the register at 9 o'clock includes a 24-hour counter. Even more impressive is that all this information is presented on a versatile 35mm x 32mm case. Keen-eyed collectors will also notice the Sigma distinction below 6 o'clock, which signifies the use of gold indices and hands. This authentic used Patek Philippe is a treasure in the eyes of watch aficionados worldwide. Take advantage of the chance to add it to your collection today in excellent secondhand condition.

name: Pre-Owned Rolex 40MM Submariner 16800
description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 16800 (1982) is referred to as a transitional model. Rolex went from acrylic to sapphire crystal, an updated movement with quick-set date, and at the beginning of the run the watches featured matte dials like the previous 1680. Later in the production Rolex changed the dials to glossy with white gold surrounds. These are known as transitional models due to the blend of older and new features Rolex decided to use together. These early 16800s with matte dials are the perfect mix of vintage styling with modern touches like the sapphire glass and quick-set date.

name: Vintage Rolex Explorer 1016 Glossy Gilt Dial
description: Rolex introduced the 1016 Explorer in 1959 and it was in production until 1989 making it one of the longest running produced references from the brand. At the beginning of the run Rolex made the dials glossy and then switched to the matte style around 1966. The example we have here has a beautiful glossy dial and is from 1966, so it would have been the last variation of the glossy dial before Rolex did the switch to the matte version. The watch we have here is in fantastic condition and is fresh to market. Finding glossy, gilt 1016's is getting harder and harder everyday so we are pleased to offer this one. The lume has all aged to a pleasing pale yellow color that just pops against the glossy black background. The gilt colored text has remained vibrant and also looks great surrounded by the glossy black. The inside caseback on this watch is dated II.66, the case serial number lines up to circa 1966 and the bracelet is stamped "1/67" so everything checks out which is always nice. Oftentimes these original bracelets get worn out and lost over the years, but when they are still in good shape and fully intact it just completes the look and feel of these vintage Explorers.

name: Rolex Submariner 1680 Stainless Steel
description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 1680 (1978) is one of the most sought-after vintage watches on the market. It hails from the legendary Submariner collection, complete with a waterproof case, 60-minute diver's bezel, and self-winding movement. The 1680 also holds a special place in Rolex history as the first Submariner to feature a date mechanism on the dial. Rolex initially made the 1680 with a single line of red text on the dial and would later move to all white text like the example we have here. These "White" 1680s have gained popularity and good ones are becoming harder and harder to find.

name: Vintage Rolex Submariner 5512 Stainless Steel
description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 5512 (1970) is an important reference in Submariner history; It was the first Submariner to feature crown guards, a detail that all Subs would have going forward and still do today. Throughout the production of the 5512 Rolex made many different variations, from glossy dials to matte dials with many slight updates and changes. The 5512 may look nearly identical to the 5513 (that came out in 1962, three years later) but the main difference would be that the 5512 has the chronometer certified movement (COSC). Since the 5512 had a COSC movement, they were more expensive than the 5513 and were not as popular, we see less of them in general. The 5512s would typically have four lines of text at the bottom of the dial and the 5513 always has two; that is one good way of telling apart the references at a glance Its not always that simple, early examples of the 5512 also have two lines of text, but still have the COSC movement.  Overall the 5512 is a cult favorite and we see many collectors gravitate towards these especially after they have gone down the rabbit hole.

An upgrade from the ref. 1655, the ref. 16550 also received a thinner 24-hour hand and the now-iconic Rolex sports watch dial configuration that includes Mercedes hands and circle, baton, and inverted triangle hour markers. The Explorer II 16550 wristwatch is still fitted with a fixed 24-hour bezel and is presented in all-steel. The edition that you see here today is a very desirable variation that also features a striking black dial.

This example has the word "Submariner" written in red text and collectors refer to these as the "Red Submariner." Rolex did this until around 1975 and then they switched to all white text. Collectors tend to gravitate towards these Red Subs and we have seen demand increase significantly in the last couple years.

name: Vintage Rolex Submariner 5513 Stainless Steel Oyster
description: Pre-Owned Rolex Submariner ref 5513 (1983) was one of the longest continually produced references from the brand. Rolex initially used glossy dials in this model and swapped to matte around 1966. Rolex made many variations of the matte dial and this circa 1983 example has a "Maxi" dial.  Rolex made these "Maxi" dials from around 1978 to 1984. "Maxi" refers to the lume plots being larger than the ones on previous 5513s. This watch has a Mark V dial and some characteristics of this variation would be the word Submariner above the depth rating and it being longer than the depth rating below. This 1983 example is not only a Maxi dial, but it is the last version of the matte dial 5513, Rolex started transitioning to the glossy dials with white gold surrounding the lume plots on the dial in 1984. Collectors tend to gravitate towards these because of the subtle, yet more striking appearance.

The 16550 was also the first Explorer II to sport the now-standard Mercedes-style hands and dial with dot, triangle, and baton hour markers. It was also the first Explorer II to offer a white dial which is something Rolex still offers today. The reference 16550 was pretty short lived, only available from approximately 1984 to 1989 when it was replaced by the ref. 16570.

name: Pre-Owned Rolex Explorer 16550 Black Dial
description: The Rolex 16550 is a very desirable variation of the Explorer tool watch. It was also one of the first instances of an Explorer model to feature classic Mercedes hands as well as the triangular, round, and rectangular hour markers that are often found on many modern Rolex tool watches. The Explorer II is a spelunker's watch at heart and also includes a fixed 24-hour bezel, a dedicated arrow hand on the dial, contrasting lume for an easy reading, and substantial waterproofness. The ref. 16550 is a cult favorite among many used Rolex collectors in-the-know and is an excellent choice for your next luxury watch investment.

The Rolex 1601 for sale here today displays the time with remarkable arrowhead hour markers and dauphine hands. The ref. 1601 also features the discontinued cal. 1570 Perpetual movement. It is in great condition for a vintage wristwatch and is in stock and ready to purchase today.  To view additional models within this collection visit our Rolex Datejust watches page.

description: Pre-owned Rolex Datejust ref 116234 (2008-2009) is fully equipped with the latest in Rolex watch making technology. First, is the 36mm Oyster case. Rolex utilizes a process of screwing the case back, bezel, and Twinlock crown to the Monobloc middle case when crafting the 6-digit Oyster case, hermetically sealing it and ensuring waterproof protection up to 100 meters. The case is also outfitted with a scratch-resistant sapphire crystal and magnifying Cyclops lens, enlarging the date display 2.5 times. The addition of an 18 karat white gold fluted bezel creates what is known as White Rolesor, a stylish blend of steel and white gold.

name: Rolex GMT-Master II Ref 16760 Coke
description: Pre-owned GMT Master II ref 16760 (1987) is one of the most highly collectible references in the GMT Master line up.  Produced from 1983-1988, the reference 16760 was the first GMT Master II.  Its case is notoriously larger in size to accommodate the addition of an independent 24-hour hand, a feature that was new to the GMT Master II line.  Because of its larger size, the GMT Master II reference 16760 was lovingly nicknamed the "Sophia Loren" or "Fat Lady".  The newly added independent 24-hour hand increases the functionality of the GMT Master II, allowing the wearer to track up to three different time zones at once without disturbing the other hands.  The 24-hour hand is paired with a rotating black and red "Coke" bezel with 60-minute graduations and serrated edges - a perfect match to the black dial topped with Tritium hour markers and sweeping "Mercedes" hands.

This reference will withstand everyday wear while looking impressive on the wrist.  The case is masterfully designed to withstand depths of up to 330 feet by screwing the case back, bezel, and Twinlock screw-down crown to the Monobloc middle case.  Additionally, the case is fitted with a scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, ensuring a near-flawless finish.  The case is paired with a silky Oyster bracelet with high-polish center links, creating a secure fit on the wrist.  A COSC certified calibre 3135 self-winding movement with 31 jewels, a Quickset function, and a Paramagnetic blue Parachrom hairspring lies within the case for a singularly reliable reading.
case: Stainless steel (36mm) w/ 18k yellow gold Smooth bezel, inner reflector ring engraved with serial number and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: White w/ Roman numeral hour markers
bracelet: Stainless steel and 18k yellow gold Oyster w/ Folding Oysterclasp w/ Easylink 5mm comfort extension link

name: Rolex GMT Master 16700 Pepsi Bezel
description: Rolex developed the GMT Master as a dual-time tool watch. By reading the arrow hand against the 24-hour rotatable bezel, the wearer can keep track of both home and local time simultaneously. Ref. 16700 is the last of the GMT Master references before it was discontinued and replaced by the GMT Master II. It's a prized collector's item for its nostalgic design set and its place in Rolex history. The example you see here is even more desirable because it also features what many refer to as a Rolex Pepsi bezel, including a red and blue insert to distinguish between day and night hours.
case: Stainless steel (40mm) w/ bidirectional rotatable bezel, blue and red "Pepsi" insert and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Black w/ luminous display and red GMT hand
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Folding Oysterclasp

description: Pre-owned Rolex Datejust ref 178240 (2011 - 2023) is a mid-size edition of the famous dress watch. Instead of a traditional 26mm or 28mm ladies case, this mid-size example features a slightly larger 31mm case. It's still feminine while exuding a level of contemporary styling that many collectors seek. Presented here in all-steel, this silver dial ladies model is also very easy on the wallet.
case: Stainless steel (31mm) w/ Smooth bezel, inner reflector ring engraved w/ serial number and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Silver w/ Superluminova hands and Index hour markers w/ black chapter ring
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Folding Oysterclasp w/ Easylink 5mm comfort extension link

name: Rolex Steel Datejust 126234
description: Pre-owned Rolex Datejust ref 126234 (2011 - 2023) includes a striking selection of new dial colors, such as the handsome white Roman numeral dial you see here today. The dial pairs beautifully with the white metal finish, and the collection's iconic jump date mechanism is ever-present at the 3-hour marker alongside a Cyclops magnifier. This Rolex is presented in White Rolesor, a flawless pairing of durable Oystersteel with 18k white gold. Lustrous, versatile, and full of character, it's no wonder why so many Rolex enthusiasts adore the exquisite design of the ref. 126234. Add it to your watch box today in excellent secondhand condition.
case: Stainless steel (36mm) w/ 18k white gold Fluted bezel, inner reflector ring engraved w/ serial number and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: White w/ Roman numeral hour markers
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Folding Oysterclasp w/ Easylink 5mm comfort extension link

name: Pre-Owned Rolex Datejust 126233 Steel & Gold
description: Yellow Rolesor is prized for its effortless pairing of steel with gold. Forged entirely in-house, this handsome two-tone finish is of the highest quality and will hold its value incredibly well. Not to mention, it's also versatile and is suitable for just about any occasion. Reference 126333 is a newer model Datejust 36, complete with an upgraded case and bracelet and integration to the cal. 3235 Perpetual movement. An evolution of the calibre 3135, this movement includes a skeletonized Chronergy escapement that is 15% more efficient than its predecessor and, therefore, boasts a longer 70-hour power reserve. As a traditional Datejust watch, this pre-owned Rolex also features the jump date mechanism at the 3-hour marker, a waterproof Oyster case, and self-winding technology.
case: Stainless steel (36mm) w/ 18k yellow gold Fluted bezel, inner reflector ring engraved w/ serial number and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: White w/ 18k yellow gold Roman numeral hour markers
bracelet: Stainless steel and 18k yellow gold Oyster w/ Folding Oysterclasp w/ Easylink 5mm comfort extension link

name: Rolex Explorer 214270 Mark 1 Black Dial
description: The history of the Rolex Explorer began in the early 1950s when Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay became the first men to reach the summit of Mount Everest. It is rumored Rolex furnished the climbers with Oyster watches. Shortly after that historic climb, the Explorer was released. Its design is centered around creating a tough watch that will read true even while traversing some of the toughest terrains in the world. Rolex released ref. 214270 in 2010, featuring a larger 39mm Oyster case, a new calibre 3132 perpetual movement, and improved materials such as 904L Oystersteel, scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, and brighter lume. The preowned Rolex Explorer that is presented here today is a handsome example of the line that displays the time on a Mark I dial topped with luminous baton markers and Mercedes hands and silver Arabic 3/6/9 hour markers.
case: Stainless steel (39mm) w/ Smooth bezel, inner reflector ring engraved w/ serial number and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Black Mark I dial w/ Chromalight hands and Index markers w/ non-luminous silver Arabic 3, 6 and 9 o'clock
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Oysterlock clasp w/ Easylink 5mm comfort extension link

name: Rolex Yacht-Master 16622 Platinum
description: The Yacht-Master is Rolex's dressed up version of the ever-popular Submariner divers watch.  While the Submariner is made for underwater adventures, the Yacht-Master is designed for voyages above the surface of the ocean.  Its 40mm Oyster case is equipped with a scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, a screw-down case back, and a waterproof screw-down crown that is resistant to depths of up to 330 feet.  Just enough protection for a quick dip in the sea.  The platinum timing bezel features 60-minute graduations and a rotatable design that can be used to measure the distance between buoys or sync with race start times.  A matching platinum maxi dial topped with luminous hour markers and hands, and a flat link Oyster bracelet and Oysterlock clasp completes the eye-catching all silver design of this striking luxury watch.
case: Stainless steel (40mm) w/ platinum bidirectional rotatable time-lapse bezel and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Platinum w/ Superluminova hands, red second hand and hour markers
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Folding Fliplock clasp

name: Rolex Daytona 16520 Stainless Steel
description: Pre-owned Rolex Daytona Ref 16520 (1994) chronograph with stopwatch functions, the Rolex Daytona is accompanied by standard seconds, minutes, and hour subdials as well as an engraved Tachymeter bezel. The Rolex 16520 for sale here was released in the early 1990s and utilizes a Zenith "El Primero" calibre 4030 self-winding movement. Modified by Rolex to include a new escapement and larger free sprung balance, a reduction to 28,800 BPH, and the removal of a date function, the calibre 4030 will perform to Rolex's highest standards. The reference 16520 also introduced the scratch-resistant sapphire crystal and a larger 40mm Oyster case size to the Daytona line. The reference 16520 that is offered here today is an exceptional find, with all-steel Daytonas becoming increasingly difficult to procure.
case: Stainless steel (40mm) w/ engraved Tachymeter bezel, scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Black w/ luminous hands and Index hour markers w/ 60-second, 30-minute and 12-hour sub dials
bracelet: Stainless steel Oyster w/ Folding Fliplock clasp

The series has been in production for over seventy years and is a fixture on wrists worldwide. While there are countless design sets to choose from, one of the most iconic remains the steel and gold model with a fluted bezel and a 5-piece link Jubilee bracelet. Reference 116233 is a contemporary variation of the steel and gold Rolex that also includes a chronometer-rated cal. 3135 Perpetual movement, scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, engraved rehaut, and Twinlock waterproof screw-down crown with two sealed zones.

The central hands are crafted from yellow gold, similar to the case and fluted bezel. Of course, the automatically changing date display also makes an appearance on the dial along with a magnifying Cyclops lens for 2.5x magnification. The highly regarded Rolex calibre 3135 perpetual movement beats within the case for a reliable reading and is protected up to 330 feet, thanks to the addition of a Twinlock screw-down crown.

name: Rolex Sky-Dweller 336235 18k Everose Gold
description: Pre-owned Rolex Sky-Dweller ref 336235 (2023) featuring a robust case, intricate movement, and a stunning selection of precious metal finishes. In 2020, Rolex added the innovative Oysterflex rubber strap as a factory option for the Sky-Dweller collection, essentially changing the entire aesthetic of the beloved Rolex annual calendar watch. The Big Crown, once again, has given us a new variation of the Sky-Dweller furnished with a new caliber 9002 Perpetual movement, now with the iconic Chronergy escapement and a new oscillating weight. Ref. 336235 is the current-production Everose model on Oysterflex. It boasts an impressive 72-hour power reserve, a classy white dial, and lustrous 18k Everose gold. The time, date, month, and secondary time zone are all displayed on the dial, creating a watch that perfectly embodies the ultimate in both form and function.

name: Omega Seamaster Diver 300M GMT
description: Pre-owned Omega Seamaster 300 M GMT ref 2538.20.00 "Great White" is a cult favorite among luxury watch collectors in the know. In addition to being discontinued, ref. 2538.20.00 pairs the water resistance of the iconic Seamaster with a convenient GMT function and a striking white dial with sword-shaped hands and robust baton-style hour markers - a feature set not offered by the brand since ref. 2538.20.00 was discontinued in the early 2000s. We also can't forget the robust stainless steel bezel decorated with large 24-hour graduations. The dial features the collection's signature wave pattern but now features the "GMT Chronometer" text instead of the depth rating. The case does not feature the standard helium escape valve, although it maintains the same 300 meters of water resistance as the rest of the series outfitted with this feature. A unique and striking collector's item with a lot of charm.
case: Stainless steel (41mm) w/ bidirectional rotatable GMT bezel and scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: White w/ luminous hands and hour markers

description: Pre-owned Rolex Submariner ref 16610T (2008). Rolex produced the ref. 16610 from the late 1980s until 2010. Later-production examples of the iconic dive watch are distinguished by modern design elements afforded to the series just before the 6-digit Submariner came to market, including an engraved rehaut, a case without lug holes (as distinguished by a "T" at the end of the reference number), and Super-LumiNova. The pre-owned Rolex for sale here was produced in 2008 and is in overall excellent secondhand condition. It sports a scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, a uni-directional bezel mounting, a high-beat caliber 3135 movement with automatic winding, and a 300-meter depth rating. It's perfect for underwater explorations, yet looks exceptional dressed up or down while on land.

Die-hard collectors appreciate the undeniably retro and art deco aesthetic of the older models, like the 1976 Rolex Cellini for sale here. Later in the production Rolex changed the dials to glossy with white gold surrounds. These are known as transitional models due to the blend of older and new features Rolex decided to use together. These early 16800s with matte dials are the perfect mix of vintage styling with modern touches like the sapphire glass and quick-set date.

The notched edges on the bezel as well the larger crown guard, create a watch that is extremely easy to use while in the water. the sturdy 3-piece link Oyster bracelet comes equipped with a reliable Oyster clasp that won't accidentally pop open while in the water. Reference 16610 is a newer addition to the Submariner family and offers all of these convenient diving features, as well as a calibre 3135 self-winding movement that was introduced with this model in the late 80's.

The perfect all-occasion watch, this preowned Rolex is a smart choice for your next luxury watch investment.

Both models remain pillars of the Rolex collection. Powered by Rolex's in-house Caliber 4130 chronograph movement, the ref. 116520 boasts chronometer-certified precision, and makes a perfect daily watch that can be worn with everything from a three-piece suit to a fire-proof racing suit.

Also referred to as the "El Primero", the calibre 4030 is a unique movement within the Rolex catalog. Today, the 16520 is a prized collector's item among those in-the-know, both for its use of the El Primero movement and its stunning all-steel finish. The example presented here today is in excellent condition and is a great chance to add the iconic Zenith 16520 Rolex to your collection.

It's also worth noting that the Sea-Dweller 16600 is powered by the long-trusted calibre 3135 Perpetual movement. It also boasts water-resistance up to an impressive 4,000 feet, making this edition of the Sea-Dweller a highly prized collector's item for anyone who appreciates an exceptional Rolex dive watch.

If you prefer the look of a dateless dial and also seek a contemporary dive watch, the ref. 114060 is the perfect watch for your wrist.

name: Rolex Daytona 16523
description: Pre-owned Rolex Daytona ref 16523 (1997 - 1998). Before the invention of the in-house calibre 4130 Perpetual movement, the Rolex chronograph was powered by the cal. 4030. This movement is often referred to by collectors as the Zenith El Primero and is widely sought-after among used Rolex enthusiasts in-the-know. The movement was famously produced in Zenith's factory and then modified by Rolex to beat at a rate of 28,800 bph and to remove the date aperture. The ref. 16523 is the steel and gold edition of the Zenith Rolex that features a traditional Tachymeter bezel calibrated to 400 units, chronograph registers on the dial, and a classic 3-link Oyster bracelet. When it comes to motorsport and Rolex history, it doesn't anymore iconic than the slate dial Rolex 16523.

name: Rolex Air-King 114200 Stainless Steel
description: Pre-owned Rolex Air-King ref 114200 (2006-2007) is an entry-level pre-owned Rolex that was developed to honor the pilots of the British Royal Air Force. The inspiration behind the watch came from the pilots' preference for their personal Rolex wristwatches of their military-issued timepieces. Hans Wilsdorf set out to release an affordable tribute watch, and the Air-King, which was a member of the Air Series collection at the time, was the result. This innovative concept has since won over luxury watch enthusiasts of all lifestyles and professions, and it can be yours today in UNWORN pre-owned Oris condition.

name: Oris Aquis Depth Gauge Stainless Steel & Rubber Strap
description: The Oris Aquis Depth Gauge is often lovingly referred to as the "watch with a hole" because of the tiny hole located on the sapphire crystal. The gauge measures the wearer's depth using the Boyle-Mariotte Law. As the wearer dives below the ocean's surface, water enters the hole and through a channel milled into the crystal, thus displaying the current depth alongside the gauge presented in yellow surrounding the dial. This innovative concept has since won over luxury watch enthusiasts of all lifestyles and professions, and it can be yours today in UNWORN pre-owned Oris condition.

name: Mens Oris Aquis Depth Gauge Stainless Steel
description: Oris released their innovative Depth Gauge in 2013. This watch accurately and reliably measures depth using physics, a tiny hole placed in the scratch-resistant sapphire crystal, and a milled channel. As the wearer ventures further below the ocean's surface, more water will enter the milled channel, indicating the wearer's current depth. While diving, the air within the channel becomes compressed, allowing more water into the channel. Conversely, as the wearer ascends back to the surface, the air decompresses, forcing the water out. This clever design doesn't rely on mechanics like other brands, making the Oris Depth Gauge even more reliable. The brand recently released a new model for 2021. Add the discontinued Oris to your collection now in pre-owned/unworn condition before it's gone!

dial: Grey w/ Superluminova BG W9 hands and Index hour markers, orange accents w/ rotatable outer minute track
bracelet: Stainless steel w/ folding clasp

name: Oris Chronoris Date Grey Textile Strap
description: The Oris Chronoris features a very distinctive design that includes a unique 1970s-era tonneau, aka barrel, shaped case, pushers on the right side of the case, and bold orange markers and hands on the dial. The stunning motorsport watch is presented in stainless steel and wears on a matching grey textile bracelet. The movement that beats within the case is suitable for adventures both on and off the race track with smooth, automatic winding stop seconds, and a 38-hour power reserve. The movement is housed within a waterproof case that also features a domed and anti-reflective sapphire crystal to preserve a highly accurate reading. You can add this retro-inspired Oris to your collection today for a very attractive, entry-level price.
case: Stainless steel (39mm) w/ scratch resistant sapphire crystal
dial: Grey w/ Superluminova BG W9 hands and index hour markers w/ rotatable outer minute track and orange accents
bracelet: Grey textile strap w/ Stainless steel buckle

name: Ladies Oris Artelier Skeleton Steel on Leather Strap
description: The true wonder of exceptional Swiss watchmaking is on full display on this edition of the Oris Artelier Skeleton ref. 01 560 7724 4051-07 5 17 33FC. The 33mm stainless steel case houses a remarkable silver Guilloche skeleton dial with sleek indices and an exposed center. The wearer has a clear view of the self-winding mechanical movement within. It's elegant and sophisticated while reminding the wearer that they are wearing an impressive piece of watchmaking technology on their wrist. As a traditional dress watch, the Oris Artelier is ideal for casual, business, or formal settings. It features durable stainless steel, scratch-resistant sapphire, water resistance up to 50 meters, and long-lasting Super-LumiNova.
case: Stainless steel (33mm) w/ exhibition caseback and scratch resisting sapphire crystal
dial: Silver Guilloche skeleton dial w/ index hour markers
bracelet: brown leather strap w/ stainless steel folding clasp

name: Vintage Omega Speedmaster Black
description: The Omega Speedmaster is one of the most iconic timepieces in existence.  The collection debuted in 1957 and would eventually outperform several other brands in a series of rigorous tests to earn the coveted title of the official watch of NASA and the distinction “Flight-Qualified by NASA for all Manned Space Missions.” Although the Speedmaster went to space in the early 1960s in an unofficial capacity, it was the Speedmaster with “Professional” written on the dial that would go on to accompany astronauts during the first Moon landing. The “Moonwatch,” as it has since come to be known, is one of the most sought-after Omega watches on the secondary market.
case: Good stainless steel 42mm case that shows scratches and wear. The fixed black Tachymeter bezel shows fading and wear throughout. The back of the caseback is stamped 145.022 ST 71.
dial: Excellent black stepped dial with patina and some wear
bracelet: Complimentary Italian leather strap (other strap options available at no cost to customer)
